snippet: A bipartisan group of senators introduced legislation that would deny the Iranian government access to its foreign-exchange reserves in the banks of other countries.
abstract: Bipartisan group of senators introduces legislation to deny Iranian government access to its foreign-exchange reserves parked in banks of other countries, estimated to be worth as much as $100 billion, mostly in euros.
lead_paragraph: A bipartisan group of senators introduced legislation that would deny the Iranian government access to its foreign-exchange reserves in the banks of other countries.

headline.seo: Bill Would Deny Iran Access to Foreign Exchange Reserves
headline.main: Senate Bill Would Halt Iran’s Access to an Estimated $100 Billion in Cash
headline.print_headline: Bill to Halt Iran’s Access To Its Cash Is Introduced
